page.title: 12THE BASS INVERURIE
page.content:
The Bass is situated at the south end of the town within the cemetry and stands between the rivers Urie (Ury) and Don. There are in fact two mounds, known locally as the Bass and the Little Bass. They are small hills of sand and gravel formed by the action of the Urie in geoglogical times. It is a fine defensive site on which stood the first Norman motte and bailey castle in N.E. Scotland. This was built by the youngest brother of King Malcolm IV, David, who was given the title of Lord of the Garioch.
The 14th and 15th century castle was probably made of wood. It was surrounded by a moat, which is now filled in. The Inverurie Museum contains specimens of mediaeval pottery removed from the moat. This formed the beginnings of Inverurie.
